abstract: Citigroup fired 11 more employees over fraud at its Mexican business. | Chipotle’s two chief executives together earned $50 million last year. | The hedge fund industry talks money at a conference in Las Vegas.
snippet: Citigroup fired 11 more employees over fraud at its Mexican business. | Chipotle’s two chief executives together earned $50 million last year. | The hedge fund industry talks money at a conference in Las Vegas.
lead_paragraph: A SHAKE-UP AT CITIGROUP  |  Citigroup is moving quickly to try to put a costly fraud at its Mexican business in the rearview mirror, firing an additional 11 employees, including four high-ranking executives in Mexico, Michael Corkery and Elisabeth Malkin write in DealBook. On Monday afternoon, the board of the bank was briefed on an internal investigation into the $400 million fraud involving a large Banamex client, and by Tuesday evening, the 11 employees in Mexico were fired.
